intro: Eriogonum thurberi, commonly known as Thurber's buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its upright, branched stems and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, triangular seeds that are dispersed by wind, aiding in its spread across arid environments. Eriogonum thurberi is well adapted to drought conditions and thrives in full sun.
